[[☃ explanation 1]]","images":{},"replace":false,"widgets":{"explanation 1":{"alignment":"default","graded":true,"options":{"explanation":"Since dilations preserve angle measures, that includes the angle measure between a segment and the ray passing through the center of dilation and the endpoint of the segment.



[[☃ image 1]]

When corresponding angles formed by a transversal have the same measures, the lines the transversal intersects are parallel.

[Experiment in Desmos](https://www.desmos.com/geometry/8uiloai40g)

When both endpoints of a segment fall on the same ray from the center of dilation, the image of the segment is still on the same ray.
